summary: The module defines an abstract task runner interface and concrete implementations that control how Prefect tasks are executed. It provides a base class handling task lifecycle and queuing, a sequential runner that processes tasks one after another, and a concurrent runner that offloads synchronous tasks to a thread pool and automatically switches to asynchronous execution when I/O blocking is detected, allowing flows to run tasks in parallel without user‑level concurrency code.
business_intent: To give Prefect users a configurable mechanism for managing task execution strategies—such as sequential, parallel, or distributed—so that flows can be run efficiently while abstracting away low‑level concurrency details.
